description: A raw data object containing dictionary info about Toki Pona words

id.description: A unique identifier for the word. May have an integer to distinguish words with the same spelling but distinct coinings.

word.description: The latin alphabet representation of the word.

author_verbatim.description: The author's original definition, taken verbatim in their words

author_source.description: The source or origin of this glyph, often a URL.

book.description: Which official Toki Pona book was this word featured in, if any.

coined_era.description: The period of time in which this word was coined, relative to the publication of the first two official Toki Pona books

creation_date.description: When this word was coined, to precision known.

author.description: The name or names of those involved in creating this word.

ku_data.description: The usage data of this word, as described in the Toki Pona Dictionary.

propertyNames.description: A possible translation of the word into English, as listed in the Toki Pona dictionary.

additionalProperties.description: The percentage of Toki Pona Dictionary survey respondents who report this translation as accurate to their usage.

parent_id.description: The most widely used word which is considered to be an exact synonym for this word.

see_also.description: The IDs of words related to this one.

resources.description: Non-Linku resources related to the specific word, such as wiki links.

sona_pona.description: A link to the word's page on sona.pona.la, a Toki Pona wiki. May redirect for words with references but no dedicated page.

lipamanka_semantic.description: A link to lipamanka's description of the word's semantic space.

representations.description: Ways of representing this word via text/computers

sitelen_emosi.description: The sitelen emosi representation of this word, a script for writing Toki Pona using emoji

sitelen_jelo.description: One or more example emojis for how the word can be written in sitelen jelo

ligatures.description: A list of sitelen Lasina representations of the word, used by ligature fonts to visually convert latin characters into sitelen pona

sitelen_sitelen.description: A URL pointing to an image of this word's sitelen sitelen hieroglyphic block

ucsur.description: The UCSUR codepoint for this word.

source_language.description: The language this word originated from

usage_category.description: The word's usage category, derived from the data of the annual Linku word survey.

deprecated.description: Whether this word is considered deprecated by its author(s).

items.description: Audio files of the words pronounced out loud

author.description: The author of the audio file in `link`.

link.description: A link to the audio file for the word, pronounced by `author`.

pu_verbatim.description: The definition of the word in specific language editions of Toki Pona: The Language of Good

en.description: The word's definition in the English edition of Toki Pona: The Language of Good

fr.description: The word's definition in the French edition of Toki Pona: The Language of Good

de.description: The word's definition in the German edition of Toki Pona: The Language of Good

eo.description: The word's definition in the Esperanto edition of Toki Pona: The Language of Good

usage.description: The percentage of respondents to the annual Linku word survey who report to use this word, by the date of the survey.

glyph_ids.description: The IDs of all sitelen pona glyphs which represent the word. The usage category of each fetched glyph may be used to show or hide glyphs.

primary_glyph_id.description: The ID of the glyph most commonly used to represent this word in sitelen pona.

synonym_glyph_ids.description: A list of ids for sitelen pona glyphs which primarily represent another word, but may be used to represent this word.

commentary.description: Localized commentary on this word, such as history, clarifications, or trivia.

__schema0.description: A unique identifier for an object in Linku. Generally named after the object.

__schema3.description: The IDs of one or more objects related to this one.

__schema4.description: A URL pointing to some external resource.

__schema5.description: Localized definition on the parent, such as a word or luka pona sign
